H0.text: All planets can support life; moons cannot, which is the main difference between planets and moons in our solar system.

H1.text: All planets have atmospheres; moons do not, is the main difference between planets and moons in our solar system.

H2.text: All planets orbit the Sun; all moons orbit planets is the main difference between planets and moons in our solar system.

H3.text: All planets are larger than all moons is the main difference between planets and moons in our solar system.

A4.text: Titan is the only satellite in the Solar System to have a substantial atmosphere.

A5.text: Phobos is Mars's inner moon. It is a small, irregularly shaped object with a mean radius of 11 km (7 mi).

A6.text: The heliocentric model described the Earth, along with all of the other planets as being astronomical bodies which orbited the Sun located in the center of the Solar System.
